steps.description: Ensure power cable is firmly connected to both computer and wall outlet
Try plugging another device into the same outlet to verify it works
If available, test with a different power cable
Look for a power switch on the back of the computer and ensure it's in the 'ON' position
Unplug computer, hold power button for 10 seconds, then try starting again

no_power.when_to_stop: If none of these steps work, the power supply or motherboard may be faulty
no_power.professional_help_needed: Bring to repair shop for power supply testing and replacement

steps.description: Ensure monitor cable is securely connected to both computer and monitor
Try connecting monitor to another device or use a different monitor
If computer has multiple video outputs (HDMI, VGA, DisplayPort), try each one
Power off, unplug, open case, remove and reinstall RAM sticks
steps.warning: Handle RAM carefully by edges only. Ensure computer is unplugged.

steps.description: Disconnect all USB devices, printers, etc. and try starting with only keyboard and mouse

turns_on_but_no_display.when_to_stop: If display still doesn't work after these steps
turns_on_but_no_display.professional_help_needed: May need graphics card, motherboard, or RAM replacement

steps.description: A simple restart can resolve many temporary performance issues
Open 'This PC' and ensure C: drive has at least 15% free space
Search 'Disk Cleanup' in Start menu and run it on C: drive
Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc), go to Startup tab, disable unnecessary programs
steps.warning: Only disable programs you recognize and don't need at startup

steps.description: Perform full system scan with your antivirus software
Go to Settings > Update & Security > Windows Update and install available updates

slow_performance.when_to_stop: If performance doesn't improve after these steps
slow_performance.professional_help_needed: May need hardware upgrade (RAM, SSD) or deeper system analysis

steps.description: Unplug ethernet cable or disable Wi-Fi to prevent further damage
steps.warning: Do not enter passwords or access sensitive accounts until cleaned

steps.description: Restart computer and press F8 repeatedly during startup, select Safe Mode
Use your installed antivirus to perform complete system scan
Download and run Malwarebytes (on clean computer) for additional scanning
Reset browser to default settings and remove suspicious extensions
steps.warning: This will remove saved passwords and settings

virus_malware.when_to_stop: If malware persists or system becomes unstable
virus_malware.professional_help_needed: Professional malware removal and system hardening recommended
